description: An illustration of a calavera, a mold of a human skull used in the celebration of the Mexican holiday Day of the Dead (or DÃ­a de Muertos); it can be edible if made from sugar or decorative if made from clay. The calavera is largely a light blueish-green with a red illustration of a heart at the top of the skull, a ring reddish-orange triangles around each eye socket, 12 painted teeth around the lips, and yellow markings on the forehead and around the nose socket.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
